item.title: Biffa Bin overflowing and fly tipping next to it, 28th October
item.description:
The Chutney 15 Norwood Road SE24 9AA has ceased trading, they have abandoned the Biffa Bin and it is overflowing with rubbish and people are dumping more bags of rubbish next to it. Rats were by the rubbish this morning. It's unsanitary, and causing issues for the shops all along Norwood road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31-39, Norwood Road, Herne Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Around the roundabout there are lots of nails & screws deliberately dropped, 28th October
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping around bins, 28th October
item.description:
These bins serve mainly flats on Howletts Road and Half Moon Lane, including flats above the shops. The bins are supposed to be stored in the alleyway behind the shops or courtyards to the flats, but instead are being stored on the pavement. As a result, the bins are increasingly attracting fly-tipping. Could the flytipping urgently be removed please, and a solution to this problem put forward.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howletts Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cones in the way, 28th October
item.description:
Over 5 months now. Put cones in road to save two car park spaces so no one can park there and then when the cars are there the cones get put on the path making it difficult for old people and push chairs to go past. This has been reported before and the report is closed. Why ? As itâ€™s still a problem

item.title: Dangerous Tree, 28th October
item.description:
Significantly overgrown tree in need of URGENT ATTENTION. There is a large broken branch hanging in the tree which could fall and kill someone or damage a vehicle. The branches are bending telephone/internet cables. The tree is significantly overhanging my property and bird excrement is damaging my driveway and vehicle. Roots are damaging the public footpath and my driveway. There is a very large dead tree limb which could snap off in a strong wind and kill someone or damage a vehicle or property. I have been complaining about this tree for 18 months. I raised a formal complaint in June 2025, received a response on 22 July 2025 telling me this would be cut back within 2 months, and it has now been 3 months. THIS TREE IS VERY DANGEROUS!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dairsie Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
